Classes/MMMTooltip/Animation.html#/fade(.name: fade(duration:)
Classes/MMMTooltip/Animation.html#/fade(.abstract: Fade in when attaching, fade out upon dismisssing the tooltip.

Classes/MMMTooltip/Animation.html#/scale.name: scale(duration:)
Classes/MMMTooltip/Animation.html#/scale.abstract: Scale-in when attaching, scale-out upon dismisssing the tooltip.

Classes/MMMTooltip/Animation.html#/fadeA.name: fadeAndScale(duration:)
Classes/MMMTooltip/Animation.html#/fadeA.abstract: Scale and fade-in when attaching, scale and fade-out upon dismisssing the tooltip.

Classes/MMMTooltip/Animation.html#/fadeA.name: fadeAndSlide(duration:distance:)
Classes/MMMTooltip/Animation.html#/fadeA.abstract: Slide and fade-in when attaching, slide and fade-out upon dismisssing the tooltip.

Classes/MMMTooltip/Dismissal.html#/none.name: none
Classes/MMMTooltip/Dismissal.html#/none.abstract: We don’t dismiss the tooltip at all. You have to do it yourself by calling .dismiss() on the tooltip.

Classes/MMMTooltip/Dismissal.html#/timer.name: timer(interval:)
Classes/MMMTooltip/Dismissal.html#/timer.abstract: Automatically dismiss the tooltip after a given interval.

Classes/MMMTooltip/Dismissal.html#/butto.name: buttonEvent(event:)
Classes/MMMTooltip/Dismissal.html#/butto.abstract: Dismisss the tooltip when the attached button/UIControl receives a given event.

Classes/MMMTooltip/Style.html#/location.name: location
Classes/MMMTooltip/Style.html#/location.abstract: Determines the location of the tooltip arrow as well as where the tooltip will appear. For instance, on a

Classes/MMMTooltip/Style.html#/offset.name: offset
Classes/MMMTooltip/Style.html#/offset.abstract: The amount we offset the tooltip from the targetView,

Classes/MMMTooltip/Style.html#/padding.name: padding
Classes/MMMTooltip/Style.html#/padding.abstract: The amount of padding that the tooltip should use when positioning itself in the superview, so it doesn’t hug

Classes/MMMTooltip/Style.html#/backgroun.name: backgroundColor
Classes/MMMTooltip/Style.html#/backgroun.abstract: The background color of the tooltip and arrow.

Classes/MMMTooltip/Style.html#/arrowRadi.name: arrowRadius
Classes/MMMTooltip/Style.html#/arrowRadi.abstract: The radius of the arrow. Where 0 would be a sharp rectangle.

Classes/MMMTooltip/Style.html#/preferred.name: preferredPaddingMultiplier
Classes/MMMTooltip/Style.html#/preferred.abstract: How much the arrow and tooltip should try to add as padding. For example on a topLeading location,

Classes/MMMTooltip/Style.html#/preferred.name: preferredPaddingPriority
Classes/MMMTooltip/Style.html#/preferred.abstract: How hard we should try to stick to the preferredPaddingMultiplier.

Classes/MMMTooltip/Style.html#/maxWidthM.name: maxWidthMultiplier
Classes/MMMTooltip/Style.html#/maxWidthM.abstract: How wide the tooltip can get according to the superview. This is a multiplier, so at 1.0 the tooltip will take

Classes/MMMTooltip.html#/contentView.name: contentView
Classes/MMMTooltip.html#/contentView.abstract: The view to use as content that is passed upon attaching the tooltip.

Classes/MMMTooltip.html#/buttonView.name: buttonView
Classes/MMMTooltip.html#/buttonView.abstract: The button to place below the content, if any.

Classes/MMMTooltip.html#/targetView.name: targetView
Classes/MMMTooltip.html#/targetView.abstract: The view this tooltip targets, as in, where we align to.

Classes/MMMTooltip.html#/userInfo.name: userInfo
Classes/MMMTooltip.html#/userInfo.abstract: Some user info you can attach to track the tooltip when using the delegate instead of closing the tooltips yourself.
